From: Paul Deighton
Sent: 25 May 2010 15:18
To: #LOCOG All Staff Members
Subject: London 2012 confirm ArcelorMittal as tier two supporter

Dear all,

I am delighted to inform you that ArcelorMittal have become a Tier Two sponsor of London 2012 and Official Steel Supporter of the Games. Please find the press release below with more details.

Regards

Paul








[cid:image001.jpg@01CAFC1D.11810640]


[cid:image002.jpg@01CAFC1D.11810640]


25 May 2010


Media Release




London 2012 confirm ArcelorMittal as tier two supporter




The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games (LOCOG) is pleased to officially confirm ArcelorMittal as a Tier Two sponsor of London 2012 and Official Steel Supporter of the Games. The deal follows confirmation that ArcelorMittal will fund the construction of a 115m high visitor attraction in the Olympic Park in time for the Games, which will be designed by artist Anish Kapoor and structural engineer Cecil Balmond and named 'The Orbit' during Games time.

As part of the deal, LOCOG will benefit from the sale of tickets to visit the viewing platform of the tower around the Games, as well as being able to provide hospitality in the tower at Games-time. The tower is expected to be completed by May 2012 and will be an iconic presence on the skyline as well as providing visitors with spectacular views across the Olympic Park.

LOCOG Chairman Sebastian Coe commented, "The Olympic Games and Paralympic Games are already transforming east London and the addition of the Tower at Games-time will provide an added dimension to the Park. We are thrilled to have ArcelorMittal on board as a sponsor and I have great pleasure in welcoming them to the London 2012 family."

Lakshmi Mittal, Chairman and CEO of Arcelormittal, said: "With the Games being the world's biggest sporting event, we felt that London 2012 was the perfect sponsorship opportunity.  We're excited about being associated with this great global sporting event and being able to showcase the versatility of steel at it with the ArcelorMittal Orbit." He added, "I'm also personally pleased to be able to give a little something back with this initiative to London, which has been my home for many years."

The Orbit will stand in the southern part of the Olympic Park between the Stadium and Aquatics Centre. After completion, the Olympic Park Legacy Company will take ownership and run the tower.


- Ends -



For further information please contact the London 2012 Press Office on +44 (0)203 2012 100 or visit the website at www.london2012.com. Find out the latest from London 2012 HQ on our blog http://blog.london2012.com or follow us on Twitter http://www.twitter.com/london2012
Notes to editors:

As it heads towards its £2bn budget for staging the Olympic and Paralympic Games, LOCOG has seven domestic Tier One Partners - adidas, BMW, BP, British Airways, BT, EDF and Lloyds TSB. There are now seven domestic Tier Two Supporters - Adecco, ArcelorMittal, Cadbury, Cisco, Deloitte, Thomas Cook and UPS. From: Paul Deighton
Sent: 25 May 2010 15:18
To: #LOCOG All Staff Members
Subject: London 2012 confirm ArcelorMittal as tier two supporter

Dear all,

I am delighted to inform you that ArcelorMittal have become a Tier Two sponsor of London 2012 and Official Steel Supporter of the Games. Please find the press release below with more details.

Regards

Paul








[cid:image001.jpg@01CAFC1D.11810640]


[cid:image002.jpg@01CAFC1D.11810640]


25 May 2010


Media Release




London 2012 confirm ArcelorMittal as tier two supporter




The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games (LOCOG) is pleased to officially confirm ArcelorMittal as a Tier Two sponsor of London 2012 and Official Steel Supporter of the Games. The deal follows confirmation that ArcelorMittal will fund the construction of a 115m high visitor attraction in the Olympic Park in time for the Games, which will be designed by artist Anish Kapoor and structural engineer Cecil Balmond and named 'The Orbit' during Games time.

As part of the deal, LOCOG will benefit from the sale of tickets to visit the viewing platform of the tower around the Games, as well as being able to provide hospitality in the tower at Games-time. The tower is expected to be completed by May 2012 and will be an iconic presence on the skyline as well as providing visitors with spectacular views across the Olympic Park.

LOCOG Chairman Sebastian Coe commented, "The Olympic Games and Paralympic Games are already transforming east London and the addition of the Tower at Games-time will provide an added dimension to the Park. We are thrilled to have ArcelorMittal on board as a sponsor and I have great pleasure in welcoming them to the London 2012 family."

Lakshmi Mittal, Chairman and CEO of Arcelormittal, said: "With the Games being the world's biggest sporting event, we felt that London 2012 was the perfect sponsorship opportunity.  We're excited about being associated with this great global sporting event and being able to showcase the versatility of steel at it with the ArcelorMittal Orbit." He added, "I'm also personally pleased to be able to give a little something back with this initiative to London, which has been my home for many years."

The Orbit will stand in the southern part of the Olympic Park between the Stadium and Aquatics Centre. After completion, the Olympic Park Legacy Company will take ownership and run the tower.


- Ends -



For further information please contact the London 2012 Press Office on +44 (0)203 2012 100 or visit the website at www.london2012.com. Find out the latest from London 2012 HQ on our blog http://blog.london2012.com or follow us on Twitter http://www.twitter.com/london2012

comments.value: Suggest plan, HTML holding page and alternative host, construct PDF help guide
Suggested solution for emergency web site, need to discuss exact requirements / what kind of budget is available for this work, as both will effect the scope of it.
Updated due date from LOCOG: 5/3.
An emergency html page is being created - will forward when available.

Hi Morag,

Does this need to go in the CMS and be editable? 

I assume the ideal would be sync up with content from the main home page automatically?

Do we also need to host it on a different server/ISP to the main ones? is this in hand? (have suggestions on how to achieve this but wil wait for your reply)
Hi there, both good points. It depends on where we are going to put this page - let me check with Huw and I'll get back to you!
Well past our due date. Could you suggest a new date?

I actually already have this emergency page - we just need to upload it.

 

I was thinking it would live in the folder Temporary > Pages >
Unavailable.

 

Is it possible to upload this and ensure it doesn't appear in the site
search?

 

________________________________

OK This is now done, we may want to talk about how you can switch it over yourself later:

1) Temp index template and Content templates now in the CMS along with all the assets

'Unavailable - Home' and 'Unavailable - Content' respectively you can create pages with either.

2) I have crated two pages in /temporary/pages/unavailable/

The first is a "Sorry, london2012.com is temporarily unavailable" page made with 'Unavailable - Home' who's path *is* important (see below) but feel free to update the text.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/temporary/pages/unavailable/index.html

The second is a test page made with 'Unavailable - Home' is just an example page and nothing depends on it (but you can link the above page to pages created with this template)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/temporary/pages/unavailable/index.html

I'm not sure if you want both an emergency site and a  "Sorry, london2012.com is temporarily unavailable" page.

Maybe the 'emergency site' could live in the /temporary/pages/HTML folder ?

3) Everything in /temporary/ is hidden from the search engine

4) Switchover / how to use 

As I understand it there are several use cases;

i) As a maintenance page if we have to take all or some of the site down, in which case we want to redirect users here.
/temporary/pages/unavailable/

To this end I have setup some redirects (commented out) in the Apache .htaccess access file ready for use whenever we need them [I have included them below for technical reference; they are also sitting in the config file with a comment]. This is a technical task, but should be fairly easy for anyone with basic technical knowledge to do, please let me know if you woudl like some more detailed instructions on this; it may make sense to add them to any 'emergency plan' you have.

ii) An emergency site, in case of well, emergencies. I guess the two things you are covering here are 

a) the facility to have ready / put up a simple site in case of a major issue or news story and you just want all attention focused on that and not the site as a whole 

b) an issue with networks etc. and you just want a site you can edit by hand [it should be noted you can already edit 99% of the site by hand as it is all HTML/PHP on the live severs].

If you create a small site within /temporary/pages/html/ (or any other directory) we can write up some notes for you on how we would 

a) switch to it and
b) how you could edit it on the live servers directly if need be.

The third thing you may want is a copy of that emergency site synced to a server *outside* of the main server environment, this is something I haven't covered in this ticket but may be worth considering.  

So the things not covered in this ticket (which you may want to open a separate ticket for, but may want to discuss first) are:

- documentation on switching to maintenance mode for 3rd parties (above what is described above, this will have a technical element) 
- documentation on switching to an emergency site for 3rd parties (above what is described above, this will have a technical element) 
- editing of the emergency site direct on the live server and how to sync content to the rest of the farm (familiarity with HTML and FTP will be required as will access the the servers, you may need to decide who and how people get access to the live servers to make sure we don't breach any security implications)
- synchronization of emergency site to a 3rd party server (it may be that you want this server outside of BT's network to cover all eventualities)

thanks

Jamie


--

Switching to a temp page for maintenance, this is commented otu in .htaccess at the root of the site

# -- TEMPORARY / MAINTINANCE / EMERGENCY SITE (uncomment the five lines below / 94-193-102-181 is Kitsite) --
#RewriteEngine On
#RewriteCond %{REMOTE_HOST} !94\193\102\181
#RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !\.(css|gif|ico|jpg|js|png|swf|txt)$
#RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !^/temporary/pages/unavailable(.*)$
#RewriteRule .* /temporary/pages/unavailable/index.html [R=307,L]

Hi Liz,

Yes I changed it due to the strapline issues / the strapline being 
removed.

I didn't realise it was begin imported anywhere automatically and 
therefore that order was important.

What do we do about the strapline field, just output a blank? 
[remember the description field *is* the strapline]

Jamie

Hm. Depends on how the ordering is. Could you put the actual content of the description field into the column she’s called ‘strapline’ (you can call it description) and just get rid of strapline (the duplicate) all together?

Hi Liz,

That's what I did, but then the columns bunch up..

Sorry if it sounds like I am being awkward, I'm honestly not, but we 
removed the duplicated field (as we we're asked to, in a roundabout 
way) and now we are being asked to add it back, I just want everyone 
to understand what they are getting and any implications. As I 
understood it the export wasn't being imported into any system and 
therefore the order of field (other than where to look for them) was 
unimportant.

I'm just a bit concerned at the trouble the ad-hoc nature of changes 
have caused us so far.

I will add both fields back in, we're actually almost live now so 
expect the number of changes from no won will be low.

But we really do need to have more change control over these kind of 
changes in future, almost like a checklist before anything is done:

- Request
- Reason
- Possibly people this will affect (and time to think about it)
- Possibly systems this will affect (and time to think about it)
- Data integrity issues with this change
- What code needs changing, order of changes and date of change(decide 
on)

The ad-hoc changing of fields is something that might not seem (and 
may not be) particularly technically hard to do, but if they are made 
in isolation the repercussions can be very expensive to rectify later 
on.

I think we need may need to make a rule that any change to a data 
model, needs at least 24hrs thought and be agreed by Kieran or myself.

btw. can I just say there is absolutely no finger pointing here, if 
anything I should have enforced the above from day one as it is 
totally unrealistic to expect the Open Weekend team to understand why 
a simple change may not always be as simple as it seams or can't be 
changed immediately.

As I said above I will reinstate the duplicate field, and make both 
description and strapline field output what (in the back end) is 
called description (ie. a short summary line / paragraph)

thanks

Jamie

I’m not asking you to put it back? I really, literally, just want the columns in their original order. You never got rid of all the columns, anyway! They just reshuffled, and the strapline one came in blank.

Ok I think it back as it was, hadr to tell as I only had one old version of the file to go on.

Jamie

This looks to me like the same issue as http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/772. Marked as high.

Ticket #772 "High Visibility style-sheets" was closed and merged into this ticket.

Last Comment in #772: Looking very out-of shape, pictures over text, etc.  See attached.
Cool. Thanks.
This might be quite a bit of work. We need to discuss.

Ticket #903 "Issue with stylesheets" was closed and merged into this ticket.

Last Comment in #903: There are some issues with the “High visibility” style sheet – pictures hide text, text overlying text.

See grabs
It needs to be done. Don’t understand why this would have happened – don’t think it was like this to go live. Afraid I rather see it as a bug...

Hi Liz,

Are you simply talking about the overlaid images on the home page and 
are happy with the high visibility style sheet on the rest of the site?

If so then yes that is something we can look at fixing, if not read 
on...

Jamie

---

Unless I am mistaken / you are talking about a single issue that has 
recently broken, the high visibility style sheet has never looked 100% 
correct since the re-launch and even some time before that.

The reason why I am hesitant to handle a ticket labelled 'fix high-vis 
style sheet' without prior discussion is that you could effectively be 
asking us to (retrospectively) create a universal style sheet that 
covers all types of pages and content (legacy, new, forms, flash etc.)

That's not to say it can't or shouldn't be done, simply stating that 
it is a very open ended and possibly large piece of work and we need 
to be clear what the budget / our remit is here before we start.

I'm not even clear myself what the high-vis style sheet /should/ look 
like. Is it OK that all text just display without any layout, ie. 
elements just list one after?

It may be that you decide that it might make more sense to tackle the 
high vis by taking the 'dyslexic' style sheet (which does seem to work 
in most places) and just change the colour of it? Or (given a possibly 
high cost) of retrospectively creating the perfect high viz style 
sheet you may want to query with Ability.net if this is the best 
approach / use of budget and if times have moved on and people now 
adjust stuff like this in their own browsers.

First, let’s get the overlapping images sorted on the homepage.


Second, ‘I'm not even clear myself what the high-vis style sheet /should/ look
like. Is it OK that all text just display without any layout, ie.
elements just list one after?’ --> yes, this is pretty much it



Moer later
Hey Lars, If you get a moment can you look at the overlapping images on the high viz version of the home page, the rest can wait for now.
did some cleaning here and there
